article_text: SACRAMENTO (AP) — A Superior Court jury has decided that former suicide hotline volunteer Frank Snyder was sane when he tried to murder a chronic caller. The jury Monday rejected Snyder’s claim that a longstanding mental illness affected his notions of right and wrong. Snyder, 29, admitted the Feb. 12 attack on Benjamin Carlson, 52, who suffered cut wrists and a slit throat.
article_headline: Hotline worker’s plea of insanity unproven
